definitions.definition: Relating to the basic , essential or fundamental part of something.
Fundamental : serving as a building block for more complicated structures or processes .

subdefinitions.definition: Involving only a single reaction step and transition state .

Which performs a row or column operation on another matrix when the two are multiplied; see Elementary matrix on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia ( Such matrices are called "elementary" because they generate the general linear group ).
Arising from Vieta's formulas ; see Elementary symmetric polynomial on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia

definitions.definition: Straightforward , employing only basic techniques; not requiring substantial knowledge (of some particular domain , object , etc.).

subdefinitions.definition: Making no use of complex analysis .
labels: mostly historical outside the phrase " Elementary number theory "
subdefinitions.label_groups: number theory , of an argument or proof , mostly historical outside the phrase " Elementary number theory "

definitions.label_groups: mathematics , of an argument or proof

definitions.definition: Sublunary ; not celestial ; belonging to the sublunary sphere , to which the four classical elements (earth, air, fire and water) were confined; composed of or pertaining to these four elements.

main_definition: Relating to the basic , essential or fundamental part of something.
secondary_definitions: ( sciences ) Fundamental : serving as a building block for more complicated structures or processes .
( mathematics , of an argument or proof ) Straightforward , employing only basic techniques; not requiring substantial knowledge (of some particular domain , object , etc.).

( archaic ) Sublunary ; not celestial ; belonging to the sublunary sphere , to which the four classical elements (earth, air, fire and water) were confined; composed of or pertaining to these four elements.
